definition: mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
bar buoy/buoy marking shallows or sandbar
pinyin: qian3 tan1 zhi3 shi4 fu2 biao1

sentences.english: Electrical equipment monitors the power the buoy generates.
sentences.chinese: 電子設備監測浮標的發電情況。

sentences.english: The first five-foot wave tipped it over.
sentences.chinese: 第一個5英尺高的波浪就把浮標打翻了。

sentences.english: There is a vessel with a difficult tow on passage to Eekhavn now approaching Pelican Bank buoy.
sentences.chinese: 有一艘多拖帶船正駛向愛克號已至皮樂肯岸浮標。

sentences.english: After a given length of time the buoy sinks itself and is not recovered.
sentences.chinese: 浮標自身下沉，並且不再恢復原狀。

sentences.english: 35 feet in diameter and about 16 feet high.
sentences.chinese: 這些浮標直徑35英尺，高16英尺。

sentences.english: As the buoy moves up and down, a gauge registers the juice it produces.
sentences.chinese: 隨着浮標上下運動，一個儀表記錄它產生的電力。

sentences.english: The channel is marked by buoys.
In most cases, the buoys reached the plastic patch in less than 60 days.
sentences.chinese: 大多數情況下，浮標在不到60天內抵達塑料垃圾帶。

sentences.english: Buoys are developed 20 miles off the coast.
sentences.chinese: 在離海岸200英里的海中佈設浮標站網。

sentences.english: A buoy in the Coral Sea is also on alert.
sentences.chinese: 珊瑚海的一個浮標也報警了。

sentences.english: The buoy floated back and forth in the shallow water .
sentences.chinese: 這個浮標在淺水裏漂來漂去。

sentences.english: Each one contains hydraulic fluid and a generator.
sentences.chinese: 每一個浮標上都有液壓油以及一個發電機。

sentences.english: Now, they are large, shorebound 10-foot-high buoys.
sentences.chinese: 現在這些島還只是困在河岸上的10英尺高的大浮標。

sentences.english: Well, at least, there are buoys everywhere. Mighty scoops.
sentences.chinese: 至少，到處都有浮標，巨大的鏟子。

sentences.english: The buoy floated back and forth in the water.
This paper proposed wave-measuring method by using mother-son buoy arrays.
sentences.chinese: 本文提出了利用子母式浮標陣列進行海浪測量的方法。

definition: to move about/to go from place to place/roving/mobile
the bow or prow of a ship
to catapult/to launch/to eject (from a plane)/to shoot
